Package abalone

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • abalone.Board
  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    the board class of the Abalone project. Contains the board and can set moves. Created on 17-01-2019.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Sam Freriks and Ayla van der Wal.

    • Constructor Summary

      The constructor of the board.

        public Board​(int players)
        The constructor of the board. Given the number of players the board will be constructed in the proper way.
        Parameters:
        players - the amount of players
        Requires
        the number of players to be 2, 3 or 4

        public void setMarble​(int index,
                      Marble marble)
        Places the given marble on the given index.
        Parameters:
        index - the index according the board model
        marble - the color you want to set the index
        Requires
        index > 15 && index < 105

        col - the wanted column
        marble - the wanted marble.
        Requires

      • protocolToIndex

        public int protocolToIndex​(int index)
                    throws BoardException
        Converts the protocol index to our own index board model index.
        Parameters:
        index - of the protocol index
        Returns:
        returns the converted index
        Throws:
        BoardException - if index < 0 || index > 60
        Requires
        to give a value from 0 up and including 60

      • protocolToIndex

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> protocolToIndex​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> indexes)
                                                       throws BoardException
        Returns an ArrayList with the numbers from protocol indexes converted to the board model indexes.
        Parameters:
        indexes - according to the protocol.
        Returns:
        the ArrayList of indexes of the board model
        Throws:
        BoardException - when index is out of range

      • indexToProtocol

        public int indexToProtocol​(int index)
                    throws BoardException
        given board model index, returns the index according the protocol.
        Parameters:
        index - of the board model index
        Throws:
        BoardException - if index is not a valid board model index
        Requires
        the index to be a valid board model index.

      • indexToProtocol

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> indexToProtocol​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> indexes)
                                                       throws BoardException
        given board model index, returns the index given in the protocol.
        Parameters:
        indexes - of the protocol
        Returns:
        the indexes in the protocol that correspond with the indexes of the game
        Throws:
        BoardException - when index is out of range
        Requires
        the indexes to be a valid board model index

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the marble currently on this spot
        Requires

        Requires

        public boolean isNeighbour​(int index1,
                           int index2)

        Parameters:

        index2 - the index to be checked
        Returns:

        Returns:
        an array with all the indexes of the neighbors of the parameter.
        Requires

        public int getNeighbour​(int index,
                        java.lang.String direction)
                 throws BoardException
        Given the index and direction, returns the neighbor index in that direction.
        Parameters:
        index - of the board model index
        direction - the direction you want
        Throws:
        BoardException - when the direction does not exist
        Requires
        the direction to be a valid direction and the index to be a valid board model index

      • isValidField

        public boolean isValidField​(int row,
                            int col)
        Checks if the field exists given the row and the column.
        Parameters:
        row - on the board
        col - on the board
        Returns:
        true if 0 >=row < 11 && 0>=col < 11

      • isValidField

        public boolean isValidField​(int index)
        checks if the given index has a valid field a field is valid if it exists on the board, this includes death states. the index used is our index index, not the protocol index.
        Parameters:
        index - on the board according to the board model index

      • move

        public boolean move​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> indexes,
                    java.lang.String direction)
             throws BoardException
        moves all indexes in the list to the given direction.
        Parameters:
        indexes - of the game
        direction - the wanted direction
        Throws:
        BoardException - when it is off the board
        Requires
        the index to be between 1 and 6 length.
